text: Michael Andrew Nykoluk (December 11, 1934 â€“ January 31, 2022) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player and coach. He played 32 games in the National Hockey League (NHL) for the Toronto Maple Leafs. He was the Maple Leafs head coach for four seasons, from 1981 to 1984. He was the younger brother of longtime Canadian Football League player Danny Nykoluk. Nykoluk died on January 31, 2022 at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players Category:Ice hockey people from Toronto
title: Mike Nykoluk
